result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • John C Springsteen Sr was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Azucena Guizar under the supervision of Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John C Springsteen Sr in court.  Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger in court for John C Springsteen Sr. Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider. 
State has filed an amended complaint adding count 2 filed on 6-3-22.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng.
Defense is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
